revised_title: The Electrolytic Properties of Diluted Solutions of Sulphuric Acid: Part 1
tldr: The authors investigate the electrolytic properties of diluted solutions of sulphuric acid and find that the decrease in equivalent conductivity at extreme dilutions is not due to impurities in the solvent. They propose that the phenomenon depends on the presence of the hydrogen ion in acids, which travels slower at great dilutions than at moderate concentrations.
